description: Gravit looks great and the workflow is very simple. Anyone who has used any of the popular editors in other operating systems can feel at home at Gravit.
summary: The most easy-to-use graphics designing software on Linux

description: Really, really good for UI mockups. Inkscape is always a pain, but Gravit has let me rapidly prototype incredibly fast.
Very good program but it has a monthly fee. I used it for a long time and then they went to a subscription model like adobe. SUCKS!
summary: Great Program but its behind a month Plan

description: It was frustrating not finding a simple yet powerful vector editor on Linux. Until now. You can sinchronize your work online and access from anywhere using your browser. It is great for UX design, branding, or for creating banners for Facebook. Has a simple elegant and powerful interface. If you havent try it, please do so.
summary: The best vector editor for Linux. Period!

description:
The last version Cant be installed. Inform Checksum invalid. 

I tried install using terminal, downloading flatpak file and conventional installation using Fedora software App and not be installed.
I used to use Inkscape for long time . But lack of modern UI , cloud support made me switch to gravit . And trust me its awesome.
summary: My favourite app for graphic design work on linux

description:
How to get gravit-designer to be install on Fedora 33/34.

open terminal and become ROOT, and run those commands.

sudo dnf install snapd

sudo ln -s /var/lib/snapd/snap /snap

sudo snap install gravit-designer
Please update to the latest version
summary: Please update to the latest version
